data.title: Monte-Carlo estimation of Pi
data.solution:
import math

number = int(input())
count = 0
for i in range(number):
    x, y = [float(j) for j in input().split()]
    if math.sqrt(x ** 2 + y ** 2) <= 1:
        count += 1

print(count / number * 4)
data.statement:
A method to approximate PI is to place [[N]] random points in a x-y diagram with x and y between 0 and 1. 
Then we check which of these points are at a distance smaller or equal to 1 from the origin (0,0). The rate obtained corresponds to PI/4.

From the points you will receive in input, produce the estimation of PI.
data.stubGenerator:
read number:int
loop number read x:float y:float

write pi
data.inputDescription:
[[N]] the number of points you will receive to estimate PI.
[[x]] the x value of the point
[[y]] the y value of the point
data.outputDescription: One line which is the estimation of PI. All answers have at most 3 decimal digits, provide them all without trailing zeros.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A method to approximate PI is to place N random points in a x-y diagram with x and y between 0 and 1.
Then we check which of these points are at a distance smaller or equal to 1 from the origin (0,0). The rate obtained corresponds to PI/4.

From the points you will receive in input, produce the estimation of PI.
Input
N the number of points you will receive to estimate PI.
x the x value of the point
y the y value of the point
Output
One line which is the estimation of PI. All answers have at most 3 decimal digits, provide them all without trailing zeros.
Constraints
5 < N < 1,000
0 ≤ x ≤ 1
0 ≤ y ≤ 1
Example
Input
10
0.44665087470084275 0.7814409871720857
0.7041731240004209 0.4788892619817777
0.5886575238238624 0.7324955170095947
0.6565434828324502 0.7039153745498603
0.5775729855984102 0.3079992953472084
0.5172871993693507 0.8574159866720961
0.31215370368367445 0.5742290301153288
0.5068821107488173 0.827249751259953
0.47115127211491314 0.7567791894886847
0.7243752278897876 0.718696681541423
Output
3.2
